title: [$250] Ensure the focus in the chat switcher does not change when the API results get in

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1759408797916159) ### Problem ``` 1. CMD+K to open the chat switcher 1. Type a few letters 1. Hit arrow down to go to the 3rd result 1. Go to press enter to switch to 3rd result 1. API request completes 1. Focus jumps to 1st result, and I press enter on the 1st result by mistake ``` ### Solution Make sure to keep the focus on the row that the user switched to, even after the API results populate. That means the content of the option row can change, but if you clicked down to third row, you will remain on third row

title: [$250] [CRITICAL] Add the Create Report option when editing Report field on expenses

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

body:
# Part of the **Support the unreported expense flow in NewDot** project Main issue: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/495162 Doc section: Project: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/495162 # Feature Description This adds the Create Report option when the user edits the Report field on an expense that is already reported. So, the user goes to a workspace chat, clicks on an open report, then clicks on an expense, and then clicks on the Report field. They should see the Create Report option and the following should happen when they click it: - If the user has a default group workspace --> Create the report in the default workspace - If the user doesn't have an active workspace but has only one group workspace --> Create the report in that workspace - If the user has no active workspace but has multiple group policies --> Ask the user to pick the workspace where the new report should be created # Manual Test Steps 1. Have a user with 3 workspaces: A, B C. A is the default workspace 2. Have an open report with at least one expense in the workspace C 3. Go to workspace C chat, click on the open report, click on one expense, and then click on the Report field 4. Verify that you see the Create Report option. Click on it 5. Verify that the expense is moved to a newly created report in the active workspace A 6. Have another expense in the same open report from workspace C 7. Delete the active workspace A 8. Go to workspace C chat, click on the open report, click on one expense, then click on the Report field, and then click on Create Report 9. Verify that you are asked to choose if you want to create the new report in workspace B or workspace C 10. Pick the workspace B and verify that the expense is moved to a newly created report in the workspace B 11. Have another expense in the same open report from workspace C 12. Delete the workspace B 13. Go to workspace C chat, click on the open report, click on one expense, then click on the Report field, and then click on Create Report 14. Verify that the expense is moved to a newly created report in the workspace C
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~021973752558473855732
  • Upwork Job ID: 1973752558473855732
  • Last Price Increase: 2025-10-02

Second device: Enter incorrect code > Go back ## Expected Result: Enter magic code page is dismissed from both device after removing the secondary contact ## Actual Result: Secondary device is able to enter magic code and RBR is shown only on the secondary device after entering incorrect code ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7cbf4b1b-ebfa-4ba1-9ce3-ddaadb9943d5 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
